title: Over 4,000 cops in Western Visayas to secure 'Tigkalalag 2025'
summary: At least 4,284 personnel of the Philippine National Police (PNP) will be deployed in various public and private cemeteries in Western Visayas.

title: Bontoc, Mountain Province road mishap kills 3
summary: Three people were killed as their truck fell on Chico River after hitting two parked vehicles in Barangay Tocucan, Bontoc, Mountain Province, the Municipal Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Office (MDRRMO) said Monday.

title: Taal Volcano had 33 volcanic earthquakes --PHIVOLCS
summary: Thirty-three volcanic earthquakes were recorded at Taal Volcano in Batangas on Sunday, the Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology said Monday.

title: Cyclist hurt after ramming a car in San Mateo, Rizal
summary: A 63-year-old cyclist was hurt after ramming his bicycle down a sloped road into a car in San Mateo, Rizal.

title: Bogo earthquake survivors fix damaged graves before Undas
summary: Despite the challenges they face in repairing their damaged homes and lives in the aftermath of the powerful magnitude 6.9 earthquake that recently struck Northern Cebu on September 30, the residents of Bogo City did not forget to care for the final resting places of their loved ones as All Saints" Day or Undas approaches.

title: Taal Volcano erupts several times during weekend; Alert Level 1 still up
summary: Taal Volcano experienced several minor eruptions during the weekend but authorities advised the public not to be alarmed with the recent volcanic activity.

title: Three minor eruptions monitored at Taal Volcano --PHIVOLCS
summary: Taal Volcano in Batangas had three minor eruptions on Sunday morning, the Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology said.

title: Magnitude 4.9 earthquake hits offshore Davao Oriental
summary: A magnitude 4.9 earthquake was recorded offshore Manay, Davao Oriental on Sunday morning, the Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology said.

title: Taal Volcano spews 1.2-km ash plume into sky
summary: Taal Volcano recorded a minor phreatomagmatic eruption at its main crater on Saturday afternoon, sending a 1.2-kilometer ash plume into the sky, the Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology (PHIVOLCS) said.

title: WATCH: Kanlaon Volcano emits ash following Friday night eruption
summary: Kanlaon Volcano on Negros Island emitted ash from its summit crater three times on Saturday morning.

title: CAAP notifies pilots to avoid flying near Kanlaon Volcano
summary: The Civil Aviation Authority of the Philippines on Saturday advised pilots and flight operators to avoid going near Kanlaon Volcano after it erupted on Friday evening.

title: DSWD ready to assist those affected by Kanlaon Volcano eruption
summary: The Department of Social Welfare and Development on Saturday said it is ready to assist individuals who may have been affected by the short moderately explosive eruption of Kanlaon Volcano on Friday.

title: Kanlaon Volcano's Oct. 24 eruption caused ashfall, PDCs --PHIVOLCS
summary: Kanlaon Volcano had a short eruption on Friday, and this caused ashfall and pyroclastic density currents to flow down its slopes, the Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology said.

title: Motorist dies after truck hits car in Gerona, Tarlac
summary: A driver died, while his one-year-old daughter is in critical condition, after their vehicle was hit by a truck along a highway in Gerona, Tarlac, on Friday morning.

title: Brief explosive eruption recorded at Kanlaon Volcano - PHIVOLCS
summary: Kanlaon Volcano experienced a brief explosive eruption on Friday evening, the Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology (PHIVOLCS) said.

title: GMA Kapuso Foundation to build Kapuso-type school buildings in school in Camarines Sur
summary: The GMA Kapuso Foundation is extending its help to a school in Camarines Sur.

title: Trips to some Bicol provinces fully booked ahead of Undas 2025
summary: Buses to some provinces in Bicol are now fully booked at the Parañaque Integrated Terminal Exchange (PITX) as passengers prepare to go home to their hometowns to observe Undas 2025 this week.

title: 3 dead, 2 missing after truck falls into Chico River in Bontoc, Mountain Province
summary: Three persons died after an Elf truck fell onto the Chico River in Bontoc, Mountain Province on Monday morning.

title: Armed men attack Tipo-Tipo, Basilan, says LGU
summary: The local government of Tipo-Tipo in Basilan said Tuesday the municipality is under siege by lawless elements allegedly backed by the Moro Islamic Liberation Front (MILF).

title: One of two missing victims from fallen Elf truck in Chico River
summary: The body of one of the two missing passengers from the Elf truck that plunged straight into Chico River in Bontoc, Mountain Province was recovered on Tuesday morning.

title: Tipo-Tipo, Basilan conflict now deescalated, says Army
summary: The rido-related conflict in Tipo-Tipo, Basilan has been deescalated, according to the Joint Task Force Orion on Tuesday.

title: Comelec First Division disqualifies Cabuyao City mayor over alleged vote-buying
summary: The Commission on Elections (Comelec) First Division disqualified Cabuyao City, Laguna Dennis Felipe Hain in the 2025 May elections over alleged vote-buying.

title: Father, child dead after taking hostage-taking in Cavite
summary: A man and a young child died after the father took his two kids and a neighbor hostage in Barangay Sampaloc IV in Dasmariñas, Cavite.

title: Hagonoy Public Cemetery remains flooded despite town"s 43 flood projects
summary: Despite more than P3 billion worth of flood projects in Hagonoy in Bulacan, even the dead need to endure the flooding that has been troubling the residents of the town for several years.

title: Pampanga school suspends on-site classes for 2 weeks due to flu-like symptoms
summary: A university in Pampanga seemed to have travelled back in time to the pandemic days, with empty corridors and classrooms after the majority of its students and employees experienced flu-like symptoms

title: 4 hurt in Tipo-Tipo, Basilan conflict --Army official
summary: Four civilians were hurt during the rido or clan war-related conflict in Tipo-Tipo, Basilan on Tuesday, according to Philippine Army"s 11th Infantry Division spokesperson Captain Genesis Dizon.

title: PNP: Dawlah Islamiyah bombmaker nabbed in Sultan Kudarat
summary: An alleged bombmaker of Dawlah Islamiyah-Hassan Group has been arrested in Palimbang, Sultan Kudarat, the Philippine National Police (PNP) said on Wednesday.

title: Man dead, BJMP officer wounded in Bulacan shootout
summary: A man died after engaging policemen in a shootout for still unknown reasons in Barangay Muzon South, San Jose del Monte City in Bulacan on Wednesday.

title: Motorcycle rider dead, 2 hurt after being pelted with bottles in Floridablanca, Pampanga
summary: A motorcycle rider died while his two passengers sustained injuries after they were pelted with bottles while travelling along a road in Floridablanca, Pampanga.

title: Chemical spill hits North Bais Bay in Negros Oriental - Bais City LGU
summary: A chemical spill hit North Bais Bay in Bais City, Negros Oriental and affected 10 nearby barangays after the collapse of a dike of a food manufacturing company, the Bais City government said on Wednesday.

title: Kanlaon Volcano spews ash -- PHIVOLCS
summary: Ash emission was reported at the summit crater of Kanlaon Volcano in Negros Island, the Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology (PHIVOLCS) said Thursday afternoon.

title: Negros Oriental chemical spill prompts BFAR warning on aquatic food consumption
summary: The Bureau of Fisheries and Aquatic Resources (BFAR) Central Visayas on Thursday warned the public against consuming and collecting fish and other marine species in the areas affected by the chemical spill in Negros Oriental, particularly in the coastal waters of Bais and Manjuyod.

title: Makabayan bloc seeks probe into mining ops in Dupax del Norte, N. Vizcaya
summary: Lawmakers from the Makabayan bloc on Thursday sought an inquiry into alleged illegal mining operations by a UK-based company in Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya, which led to an alleged violent confrontation between residents and the police.

title: DOST ties up with pasalubong giant to make healthy snacks for students
summary: BACOLOD CITY - The Department of Science and Technology (DOST) has partnered with a local pasalubong giant to produce fortified, fun snacks for Filipino students in the Visayas.

title: Sibling dispute possibly led to Bulacan shootout, says cops
summary: The daylight shootout in Barangay Muzon South, San Jose del Monte City in Bulacan on Wednesday may have been triggered by a dispute between siblings, according to police.

title: UNDAS 2025: Authorities warn of 'beinte pesos" scam at port
summary: Officials of Batangas Port on Thursday inspected the pier following a complaint of alleged additional P20 payment on top of the fees that must be legally paid by passengers.

title: 3 wounded in SUV crash in La Paz, Iloilo City
summary: A speeding sports utility vehicle smashed into the rear of a parked truck in La Paz, Iloilo City, injuring the SUV"s three occupants.

title: Suspect in slay of CIDG 7 official surrenders in Pasig City
summary: The prime suspect in the slay of an official of the Criminal Investigation and Detection Group 7 surrendered to Pasig City Police in Metro Manila.

summary: Ash emission was reported in Kanlaon Volcano in Negros Island on Friday morning, the Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology (PHIVOLCS) said.

title: Man nabbed in Biñan, Laguna for possession of unregistered firearms
summary: A man was arrested during a raid in Biñan, Laguna for possession of unregistered firearms, ammunition, and explosives.

title: Only 50 of 10,000 earthquake-damaged graves in Bogo City repaired
summary: Only 50 of the 10,000 graves damaged by the magnitude 6.9 earthquake that struck Bogo City, Cebu, on September 30 have been repaired.

title: Davao Oriental hit with offshore earthquakes
summary: Two offshore earthquakes of more than magnitude 5.0 were recorded offshore Davao Oriental early Saturday, the Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology (PHIVOLCS) said.

summary: One person was killed while nine were injured after a fire broke out at Pagbilao Energy Corporation"s (PEC) facility on Friday evening.

summary: DENR holds containment measures for Negros Oriental wastewater spill

summary: Kanlaon Volcano on Negros Island emitted ash on Sunday morning, the Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology said.

title: NAPOLCOM probes cop"s alleged ties in Negros Occidental businesswoman"s death
summary: The National Police Commission (NAPOLCOM) has launched a motu proprio investigation on the police officer who is allegedly involved in the disappearance and killing of a businesswoman in Negros Occidental.

title: Another ash emission logged in Kanlaon Volcano --PHIVOLCS
summary: An ash emission was observed at the summit crater of Kanlaon Volcano on Sunday afternoon, the Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology (PHIVOLCS) said.

title: People return to Metro Manila after long Undas weekend
summary: People who stayed up north for this year"s traditional Undas observance have begun their exodus back to Metro Manila after the long weekend.

summary: A magnitude 5.6 earthquake rocked Candoni, Negros Occidental before dawn Monday, the Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology said.

title: 7,000 residents in Dinagat Islands preemptively evacuated due to Tino
summary: Some 7,000 residents in coastal areas of Dinagat Islands were preemptively evacuated as part of the province's preparations for Typhoon Tino (international name: Kalmaegi)

title: PCG: 30 fishermen rescued in Zambales
summary: At least 30 fishermen were rescued by the Philippine Coast Guard (PCG) after their fishing vessel suffered engine failure in the vicinity waters off Bajo de Masinloc in Zambales.

title: Iloilo government starts preemptive evacuations due to Typhoon Tino's impact
summary: The Iloilo provicial government has started preemptive evacuation in the province's high-risk areas, coastal and riverside communities, due to the effects of Typhoon Tino.

title: 73 PCG disaster response teams readied for Tino onslaught
summary: The Philippine Coast Guard"s (PCG) disaster response teams are preparing to respond to areas that may be affected by Typhoon Tino, which is expected to make landfall over parts of Eastern Visayas on Monday night.

title: Archbishop Uy Directs Cebu churches to serve as shelters amid Typhoon Tino
summary: Cebu Archbishop Alberto Uy on Monday ordered that churches in the archdiocese be used as shelters amid Typhoon Tino.

title: Phivolcs warns vs. lahar flow from Kanlaon Volcano amid Typhoon Tino
summary: Phivolcs on Monday warned residents near Kanlaon Volcano of a possible lahar flow due to the rain brought by Typhoon Tino.

title: Cebu cop sacked over 'bring-me-a-drug pusher" vlog
summary: A police officer in Cebu was sacked from his post after he put a controversial twist on the “bring-me” game in his vlog.

title: Girl, 8, allegedly raped by teacher inside school in Tarlac
summary: An eight-year-old student was allegedly raped by her own class adviser at a school in Tarlac.

title: Woman dies after boat capsizes in Maguindanao del Sur amid rough weather from Tino
summary: A woman died in Maguindanao del Sur after the boat that she and her children were riding capsized due to large waves amid rough weather from Typhoon Tino.

title: OCD to rescuers: Conduct safe search, rescue ops amid Tino
summary: The Office of Civil Defense (OCD) Eastern Visayas has reminded rescuers to conduct safe and rescue operations amid the onset of Typhoon Tino.

title: P96M flood control project collapses ahead of storm-induced rains
summary: Even without rains yet, a flood control project in Barangay 5, San Miguel, Iloilo has collapsed.

title: Bacolod assures response preparedness for Tino
summary: The Bacolod City Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Office (CDRRMO) in Barangay Taculing has assured response preparedness to possible emergency situation at the onslaught of Typhoon Tino.

title: Typhoon Tino batters parts of Visayas, Bicol
summary: Typhoon Tino unleashed heavy rains and strong winds in parts of Visayas and Bicol, triggering floods, power outages, and preemptive evacuations on Tuesday.

title: Over 1,400 families affected by Typhoon Tino in Butuan
summary: Around 1,432 families or 5,348 individuals have moved to evacuation centers due to strong winds and heavy rains brought by Typhoon Tino in Butuan City on Monday, November 3, 2025.

title: LOOK: Typhoon Tino devastates parts of the Visayas
summary: Several individuals were stranded and houses were damaged on Tuesday in parts of the Visayas due to severe flooding and strong winds caused by Typhoon Tino on Tuesday.

title: PH Air Force helicopter on Tino aid mission crashes in Agusan del Sur
summary: A Philippine Air Force (PAF) helicopter conducting humanitarian operations for communities affected by Typhoon Tino crashed Tuesday in Agusan del Sur, the Eastern Mindanao Command (EMC) confirmed.

title: PCG teams deployed to Typhoon Tino-affected areas in the Visayas
summary: The Philippine Coast Guard (PCG) said Tuesday it has deployed assistance and response teams to help communities affected by Typhoon Tino in the Visayas.

title: 19 reported dead in Central Visayas amid Typhoon Tino -- OCD
summary: The Office of Civil Defense (OCD) in Central Visayas said Tuesday afternoon it was validating reports of 19 deaths in the region amid the onslaught of Typhoon Tino.

title: SC issues status quo ante order on disqualification of Tarlac mayor
summary: The Supreme Court has issued a status quo ante order maintaining Susan Yap-Sulit as mayor of Tarlac City.

title: 1 dead, many missing after Typhoon Tino submerges houses, cars in Cebu City
summary: At least one person is dead and several other missing after floods spawned by Typhoon Tino swept away houses and vehicles in Cebu City on Tuesday.

title: Tino batters Leyte; many areas have no power, water
summary: The strong winds and heavy rains brought by Typhoon Tino toppled trees and caused flooding in parts Leyte.

title: BTA has until Nov. 30, 2025 to pass redistricting bill --Comelec
summary: The Bangsamoro Transition Authority (BTA) may still pass the proposed bill redistricting the seven seats previously assigned to Sulu until the end of November, according to the Commission on Elections (Comelec).

title: Tino death toll climbs to 26 -- OCD
summary: The reported death toll from the onslaught of Typhoon Tino has reached 26 as of Tuesday, the Office of Civil Defense said.

title: Tino leaves at least 48 dead in Cebu
summary: At least 48 people were confirmed dead in Cebu following the onslaught of Typhoon Tino on Tuesday, November 4, 2025, that triggered flooding authorities described as one of the worst in the island"s recent history.

title: Cebu towns reel from floods as Tino cuts power, water, communication
summary: Massive floods and power outages have left several areas in Cebu struggling to recover from the wrath of Typhoon Tino this week, with local officials facing challenges in coordinating relief operations due to poor communication and disrupted utilities.

title: Mayor calls for help after Typhoon Tino batters Cebu City
summary: Cebu City Mayor Nestor Archival called for help evening on November 4, 2025 hours after Typhoon Tino triggered massive flooding in parts of the city.

title: Typhoon Tino batters Visayas
summary: Floods, toppled trees, and soil erosion were reported as Typhoon Tino (international name: Kalmaegi) battered some areas in the Visayas, according to reports on GMA Integrated News" Unang Balita on Wednesday.

title: Babae, huli matapos magtangkang magpuslit umano ng shabu sa kulungan
summary: Babae, huli matapos magtangkang magpuslit umano ng shabu sa kulungan

title: Typhoon Tino flash floods: at least 40 houses swept away in Compostela, Cebu
summary: An estimated 40 houses were swept away by raging water from the creek in Barangay Tamiao in Compostela, Cebu as Typhoon Tino ravaged the Visayas regions on Tuesday.

title: PCG: Nearly 3K passengers stranded, sea travel still suspended
summary: Nearly 3,000 passengers remain stranded in various ports across the country as the Philippine Coast Guard (PCG) continued its enforcement of sea travel suspensions in areas affected by Typhoon Tino, particularly those still under wind signals or rough sea conditions.

title: Sea travel in Palawan suspended amid Typhoon Tino - PCG
summary: The Philippine Coast Guard (PCG) on Wednesday deferred sea travel in some Coast Guard Stations (CGS) in Palawan amid the harsh weather caused by Typhoon Tino.

title: DOE: 1.4M households have no power amid Tino"s onslaught
summary: The Department of Energy (DOE) on Wednesday said about 1.4 million household power connections in the Visayas are still without electricity following the onslaught of Typhoon Tino.

title: PAF Black Hawk makes emergency landing in Southern Leyte
summary: A Philippine Air Force (PAF) S-70i Black Hawk helicopter conducted what officials described as a “precautionary landing” in St. Bernard, Southern Leyte, after experiencing a technical issue on Wednesday.

title: Cebu still reeling from Typhoon Tino devastation
summary: The residents of Cebu are still trying to make sense of the devastation caused by Typhoon Tino that killed at least 76 people and resulted in a still to be determined amount of damage.

title: Typhoon Tino batters El Nido
summary: A convent, hospital, and school in El Nido town in Palawan suffered damage from the onslaught of Typhoon Tino, which made its last landfall in the municipality early Wednesday morning.

title: 20 dead in Negros Occidental due to Typhoon Tino
summary: At least 20 persons died in Negros Occidental following the onslaught of Typhoon Tino, according to data from the Provincial Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Office (PDRRMO).

title: Flood control project in Davao City collapsed just 8 months after completion
summary: The Department of Public Works and Highways (DPWH) and the Independent Commission for Infrastructure (ICI) conducted an inspection on Wednesday of various flood control projects in Davao City, including one that collapsed just eight months after its completion.

title: Pulong Duterte on flood control projects in Davao City: 'The structures exist"
summary: Davao City Representative Paolo Duterte denied having non-existent flood control projects in his district on Wednesday following allegations of irregularities by House Deputy Minority Leader and ACT Teachers party-list Representative Antonio Tinio.

title: Tinio flags P4.35-B flood control projects in Pulong's district as 'irregular'
summary: At least P4.35 billion of the flood control projects in the First District of Davao City from 2019 to 2022 are irregular, if not questionable, due to overlapping, double funding, and lack of details, House Deputy Minority Leader and ACT Teachers party-list Rep. Antonio Tinio said Wednesday.

title: Up to 95% of houses in Silago, Southern Leyte damaged due to Tino --mayor
summary: Up to 95% of houses in Silago, Southern Leyte damaged due to Tino --mayor
